title: Punch
guest_stars: Cindy Guyer, Jerky Boys, Dian Parkinson
synopsis: After model Cyndi Guyer, the female Fabio, explains what she looks for in a man, the Jerky Boys arrive and promptly threaten to punch Space Ghost in the mouth. The undertow of violence subsides with the appearance of model Dian Parkinson.

transcript.speaker: (Setting
transcript.dialogue: St. Peter's Square in Rome, before huge crowd, with Gregorian chanting in background. Space Ghost's voice echoes)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Salve, populi! (subtitles: Thanks for attending my magic show.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ego sum! (subtitles: Please exit to the rear of the square.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: E pluribus unum! (subtitles: That's it, show's over.)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! (subtitles: Spiritus Spatium!) (standing on statue) Space Ghost! (subtitles: Spiritus Spatium!)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (inside, with jazz guitar music in background) No use speeding now, just a few miles to the studio... (hums to himself)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room, looks at empty studio in monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still standing on statue in St. Peter's Square) Space Ghost? (subtitles: Spiritus Spatium?)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) (sighs) Better never than late... (pulls lever to start opening theme)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set) Salve, populi. Ego sum (Must stop speaking Latin!) Hi. I'm Space Ghost! On this show we've got a pair of people with yellow hair and a pair of people who wear masks. But first, welcome Zorak and the Original Way Outs.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in St. Peter's Square) (evil laugh) Ant humans, reap my wrath. When I, Zorak, rule the Earth!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I left Zorak in the Square, with thousands of earthlings! Moltar! send the shuttle for Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) We don't have a shuttle.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: On the third day, a dark cloud approached from the west...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And a mantis was thus spawned... I, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room; bored, he pulls the lever: screen changes to volcanoes and molten lava) Mmmm...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in Phantom Cruiser with Zorak) Moltar and I were worried sick!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I had them in my control...

transcript.speaker: Narrator
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor, in Mickey Mouse voice) The hot lava burns a deadly path towards the inhabited city below, the citizens, blissfully unaware of the molten danger, sleep in their hammocks of straw, while the fiery river of death flows rampant. Hah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies into his chair) Okay! If you read romance novels--and who doesn't--the face of my first guest is not unknown to you. Please welcome Cindy Guyer.

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Hello Space Ghost, how are you today?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (My kindergarten teacher used to greet me that way!)

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for having me here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, oh, yeah, yeah. On book covers you're always transforming yourself into various guises. Is that your only super power?

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm kind of like a, a witch, like a fairy tale witch in a way, I create fantasy, for people. Y'know, I become, I become everybody's dreams.

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: I become the princess, the, the saloon girl, the cave woman... you name it, I've been it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Cindy, what kind of men do you like?

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: I don't want them too strong and macho, I like a man that's, you know, a man, but real down to earth and he knows how to be sensitive.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (romantic music swells in background) Zorak, the other night I saw the most beautiful sunset.

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: He's really in touch with his feminine side. He's not afraid to be soft.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why do fresh daffodils always make me cry? (tear rolls down his cheek)

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: What kind of women to you like, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Rose Marie. (romantic music stops) Hey, you're like the female Fabio!

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I've been called that, yes I have...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like to think of myself as a male GI-Joe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You were not. Cindy Guyer, what are ya doin' now?

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Possibly negotiations, well I am, uh, with Universal to, uh, do my own little series, called "Sea Witch".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: See... Oh! Like your little series!

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: And all my books would come to life, every week. It'd be just, you know, great.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know, great. And, you've got a movie coming up.

transcript.speaker: Cindy Guyer
transcript.dialogue: Um, I have a movie coming out called "Mortal Obsession", it's...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ...with Lorenzo Lamas! I've seen that one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I thought Bruce Boxleitner was in "Final Possessions", or was that "Lethal Passions"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, with Justin Bateman... I liked that one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) Any parting wishes for the galaxy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bye then. (to camera) We'll be right back after our sponsor shoves some more stuff in front of you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We shall return... with a vengeance!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ready or not, here we come!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Sorry. (to Moltar) Why didn't you tell me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (tapping cards) Moltar, what are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just leave it on, okay pal?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My next guests use the phone all the time. Welcome The Jerky Boys!

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 2
transcript.dialogue: Well, not more frightening than our face.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are your faces wrinkly like smoked meat?

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you mind your questions?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you answer my questions?

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 2
transcript.dialogue: Well, now, you see, now we're off to a bad start, there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us all about your troubled childhood.

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: What, uh, what kind of thing is that to ask adults?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you in trouble with the law?

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: This guy needs a good punch in the mouth, if you ask me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Punch, Now that's a silly word. "Punch." You know, if you say that enough times it loses all its meaning. Punch... punch... punch...

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 2
transcript.dialogue: Boy, this, you know, this guy's bein' real flaky

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost I oughtta, I oughtta smack your teeth out over there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pu... Yeah right... (Zorak keeps saying "Punch" in background) Gentlemen, if I kissed you would you understand that I was simply being European?

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: You come near me I'll take a big eraser out, you'll be history.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ohhhhh... "CHiPs"! (he pulls his lever, "CHiPs" theme comes on)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Yes, of course. Sorry about that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looking down) This wasn't my best interview, was it?

transcript.speaker: Jerky Boy 1
transcript.dialogue: Naw, Space Ghost you're great. I used to watch you as a kid. I'm glad you're still fighting crime.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know. Moltar! When does this air?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, well, let's see... First, we'll have to pull out all the dirty words you used...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Then, we'll have to scramble it around and try to make this seem funny... That'll take about three weeks' worth of work, Earth time...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Then the writers have to basically write you out of the script, and we...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, right. (to camera) You've seen our next guest on "The Price is Right". Please welcome Dian Parkinson.

transcript.speaker: Dian Parkinson
transcript.dialogue: Are you serious? Are we doing this scene now, and you didn't even count it down?

transcript.speaker: Dian Parkinson
transcript.dialogue: My little Space Ghost! How come you're doing this to me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, what about the Bob Barker affair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The fair? I love fairs... (carnival music in background) Lights, pony rides, cotton candy, Lobster Boy. Tell me about the fair!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Diane, I have ways of making you talk about the fair.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'd say "Dian, tell me about the fair," and you'd answer. That's talking about it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's Zorak, does he scare you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Look me up, I'm a mantis. Lokar is the locust.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flipping through the script) Say... you are a mantis! I've been calling you a locust all this time!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, thanks a lot, Mr. Mantis! You're so important over there with that keyboard and everything and you don't have to pay attention, because the Mr. Mantis is way too important to be the sidekick, isn't that right Mr. Mantis!?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Magenta. Now, that's a silly word.
